channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: グーグルは、進行中のテストの一環として、「ごく一部のユーザー」が検索結果ページのニュースタブ・フィルターに一時的にアクセスできないことを確認した（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
Google confirms “a small subset of users” have been temporarily unable to access the News tab filter in search results pages as part of ongoing testing  —  News publishers are worried — with good reason — about changes coming to Google Search.

item.title: 社内メモ：バイス・メディアは「今後vice.comではコンテンツを発表せず」、既存メディア企業と提携してコンテンツを配信する可能性がある（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Internal memo: Vice Media “will no longer publish content on vice.com” and may partner with established media companies to distribute its content  —  Cuts follow failed effort by owner Fortress to sell embattled digital publisher and its brands  —  Vice Media said it would stop …

item.title: S-1：ニューハウス家のアドバンスがRedditの30.1％、テンセントが11％、サム・アルトマンが8.7％を所有、IPO後はニューハウス家が2議席を占める（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
S-1: the Newhouse family's Advance owns 30.1% of Reddit, Tencent owns 11%, and Sam Altman owns 8.7%; post-IPO, the Newhouse family will hold two board seats  —  As the tech platform prepares for a public offering, it says that most of its revenue is from advertising, but touts artificial intelligence as a growth area.

item.title: 内部メモ：バイス・メディア幹部は来週中に900人以上の従業員のうち数百人をレイオフする計画で、同社はリファイナリー29の売却に向けて交渉を進めている（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Internal memo: Vice Media executives plan to lay off hundreds of its 900+ employees over the next week, and the company is in advanced talks to sell Refinery29  —  Vice Media, which emerged from bankruptcy last year, is planning to cut hundreds of its more than 900 employees, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Redditがニューヨーク証券取引所にIPOを申請、2023年の売上高は前年比20%増の$804M、純損失は前年比43%減の$90.8M、DAUは73M、グローバルARPUは$3.42と報告（Jonathan Vanian/CNBC）
item.description:
Jonathan Vanian / CNBC:
Reddit files to list its IPO on the NYSE, reporting revenue up 20% YoY to $804M in 2023, net loss down 43% YoY to $90.8M, 73M DAUs, and a $3.42 global ARPU  —  - Reddit on Thursday filed to go public.  — Its market debut will mark the first major tech initial public offering of the year …

item.title: 情報筋Vice News編集者のジョシュ・ヴィッサーは、ブルース・ディクソンCEOを含む幹部にサイト閉鎖の噂を否定する機会を与えたが、返事はないとスタッフに語った（Lachlan Cartwright/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lachlan Cartwright / Hollywood Reporter:
Sources: Vice News editor Josh Visser told staff he gave execs including CEO Bruce Dixon a chance to deny rumors the site was shuttering, but has not heard back  —  Editor Josh Visser said he had given senior executives of the company, including CEO Bruce Dixon, an opportunity to deny rumors …

item.title: 新しいポッドキャストやホストを追加し、グッズを開発し、ライブ・イベントのプロデュースを始めたアレックス・クーパーの『Call Her Daddy』以外のメディア映画を見てみよう（Jessica Testa/New York Times）
item.description:
Jessica Testa / New York Times:
A look at Alex Cooper's media movies beyond Call Her Daddy, as her company Unwell adds new podcasts and hosts, develops merch, and begins producing live events  —  The success of Alex Cooper's “Call Her Daddy” podcast has birthed a new media company.  Can this millennial solve the riddle of what Gen Z wants?

item.title: ティム・バーク、フォックス・ニュースのコンピューター・ハッキング容疑に関する14の犯罪で起訴される。
item.description:
Tampa Bay Times:
Tim Burke is charged with 14 crimes related to alleged computer hacks at Fox News, including six counts of accessing a protected computer without authorization  —  Burke, a nationally recognized media consultant, is scheduled to appear in federal court Thursday in Tampa.

item.title: グーグル、Redditと契約、年間6,000万ドルと報道、Reddit Data APIにアクセスし、より多くのRedditコンテンツを表示、AIモデルを訓練（Abner Li/9to5Google）
item.description:
Abner Li / 9to5Google:
Google strikes a deal with Reddit, reportedly for $60M/year, giving Google access to the Reddit Data API to surface more Reddit content and train AI models  —  Google today announced an “expanded partnership” with Reddit that sees it get access to the forum website's data for training and other product uses.

item.title: Googleは、Google WorkspaceにGeminiを追加した後、Performance Max広告配置ツールにGeminiを統合し、ブランドがより長い見出しを生成できるようにする予定である（Sheila Dang/ロイター）。
item.description:
Sheila Dang / Reuters:
Google plans to integrate Gemini into its Performance Max ad placement tool, helping brands generate longer headlines, after adding Gemini to Google Workspace  —  Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google said on Thursday it will integrate its Gemini artificial intelligence models into an existing product for advertisers …

item.title: ドイツのタブロイド紙『ビルト』の有料版『ビルトプラス』は70万7000人のデジタル購読者を抱え、テレビで放映されないボクシングの試合の放映権を購入することで購読者を増やしている（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
A look at German tabloid Bild, whose paid tier, Bildplus, has 707K digital subscribers and has grown subscribers by buying rights to boxing matches not on TV  —  Bundles and sports livestreams help, but journalism drives most subscriptions for Bild.  —  The head of the digital subscriptions strategy …

item.title: [スレッド】Engadgetがレイオフと再編を発表、ニュースや特集とレビューや購入アドバイスを分離、ダナ・ウォルマンEICが退社（Max Tani/@maxwelltani）
item.description:
Max Tani / @maxwelltani:
[Thread] Engadget announces layoffs and a restructuring that separates news and features from reviews and buying advice; EIC Dana Wollman is leaving  —  Memo that went out to staffers at Engadget announcing layoffs today [image]

item.title: Substack社によると、同社のプラットフォームで有料ニュースレターを購読している顧客は、2023年2月の200万人から3M人以上に増加し、レコメンデーション機能が成長の要因になっている（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Substack says 3M+ customers subscribe to paid newsletters on its platform, up from 2M in February 2023, and credits its recommendations feature for the growth  —  - The company said it plans to expand the recommendations feature, which helps writers promote other newsletters in its network …

item.title: デンマークの裁判所において、検察当局はある男が音楽ストリーミング配信者から不正に50万2,000ポンドのロイヤリティを得ており、著作権法に違反しているとしている（Miranda Bryant/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Miranda Bryant / The Guardian:
In a Danish court, prosecutors allege a man fraudulently made ~£502K in royalties from music streamers and breached copyright law  —  Aarhus court hears he may have profited from artificially generated playbacks, in case thought to be first of its kind

item.title: 情報筋アマゾンがプライム・ビデオでの2025年NFLプレーオフ試合独占放映権に1億2000万ドル、NBCUがピーコックでの2024年1月NFLプレーオフ試合放映権に1億1000万ドル（Michael McCarthy/Front Office Sports）
item.description:
Michael McCarthy / Front Office Sports:
Sources: Amazon paid $120M for exclusive rights to show a 2025 NFL playoff game on Prime Video; NBCU paid $110M for a January 2024 NFL playoff game on Peacock  —  Out of the Big Four tech giants, Amazon is the most ambitious about invading live sports.  The giant streamer is opening …
